result.execSummary:
The defendant Erica L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may have early probation termination upon the agent's recommendation.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $58.29 to be paid to Woodman's as a condition of probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Erica L Peterson in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a plea a guilty as to count 2. Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

3 months county jail with huber - STAYED and placed on probation for 1 year
CONDITIONS: Maintain full time employment/schooling
                          Restitution in the amount of $58.29 to be paid to Woodman's
                          Court costs are waived
                          Defendant may have early probation termination upon the agent's recommendation

Defendant Erica L Peterson in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State provides copy of criminal complaint, pretrial offer and discovery.  Hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Erica L Peterson in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
